title: BBC at scene of severe flooding after Storm Claudia
text:
BBC correspondent Will Vernon has been wading through flood water that has caused widespread damage to Monmouth town centre as a result of Storm Claudia.

A family has told BBC Wales how they were rescued from their homes in the darkness by boat, while business owners said they have lost stock worth "thousands" in the flooding.

A major incident has been declared in Monmouth by South Wales Fire and Rescue Service, with crews called to 82 flood-related incidents in the wider area.

Council bosses said they were "ready and prepared but not to this level" due to rivers reaching "unprecedented" levels.
summary: A major incident has been declared in Monmouth following severe flooding caused by Storm Claudia.
